New Records: Alexis Mac Allister scored his first international goal for Argentina in the match.
Julián Álvarez extended his goal-scoring streak with a long-range shot in the 84th minute.
Paulo Dybala scored his first goal for Argentina since returning from international duty in 2023.
Key Match Events: Argentina achieved a 3-0 victory over Chile in their first competitive fixture since 2013 without Lionel Messi and Ángel Di María.
The match was a World Cup qualifier for Argentina and Chile.
The game was played at the Monumental stadium in front of 52,160 fans.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina were heavily favored to win despite the absence of key players like Lionel Messi and Ángel Di María.
Coach Scaloni emphasized the importance of teamwork and focus during the pre-match press conference.
Chile made several attempts to equalize but were kept at bay by Argentina's solid defense.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina's manager highlighted the team's resilience and depth after the win.
The victory moved Argentina to the top of the qualifying standings with 18 points.
Chile's manager expressed frustration with the team's inability to score despite multiple chances.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was broadcast live on ESPN and various international networks.
The game was followed by a large celebration from the Argentine fans in the stadium.
Argentina will face Colombia in their next qualifier, while Chile will host Bolivia.
Others: The match was the first World Cup qualifier for both teams in the 2026 cycle.
